description: Master epic for Phase 2: Transform email into a programmable control plane with Gmail + Outlook as PRIMARY V1 providers, MCP integration, and rules-as-code automation. 11 child epics + 5 provider connector sub-epics.

title: E1: Product Definition + Scope Lock
description: Convert requirements into build spec with V1 boundaries. Define persona, jobs-to-be-done, in/out-of-scope list, MVP success metrics and constraints.
acceptance_criteria:
- V1 persona + jobs-to-be-done documented
- Clear in/out-of-scope list
- MVP success metrics defined
- Technical/business constraints documented

title: E10: Migration + Onboarding Wizard
description: Make switching from Gmail/Outlook plausible. DNS checklist, import strategy, and cutover mode plan.
acceptance_criteria:
- Domain DNS checklist (MX/SPF/DKIM/DMARC) documented
- DNS checklist UI implemented
- Import strategy per provider
- Cutover mode plan (dual-delivery/forwarding)
- Onboarding wizard flow complete

title: Design first-run wizard for account setup
description: Create onboarding flow: welcome screen, provider selection (Gmail/Outlook/IMAP/Fastmail), OAuth authorization, initial sync confirmation, success screen. Show estimated sync time based on mailbox size.

title: Build initial sync progress indicator
description: Implement progress UI showing: messages synced, total count estimate, current sync speed, time remaining. Support pause/resume of initial sync. Handle sync failures gracefully with retry options.

title: Create sample rules library
description: Provide starter rules: archive newsletters, file receipts, snooze non-urgent, label by sender domain. Let users enable/disable/customize during onboarding. Export as YAML templates.

title: Implement account migration from other clients
description: Support importing settings from: Gmail filters (export XML), Outlook rules, Thunderbird message filters. Parse existing rules and convert to IntentMail YAML format with user review.

title: Build interactive tutorial for MCP usage
description: Create guided tutorial: show how to use MCP tools from Claude Code, demonstrate mail_search examples, show rule creation workflow, explain audit/rollback. Include keyboard shortcuts cheat sheet.

title: Design data export and backup features
description: Implement data export: SQLite database backup, rules YAML export, settings JSON export. Support automated backups on schedule. Create restore wizard for disaster recovery.

title: E11: Observability + Ops + Release Packaging
description: Run it, test it, ship it. Logging/tracing, integration tests, and release packaging.
acceptance_criteria:
- Logging/tracing conventions defined
- Integration test plan documented
- Fixture accounts strategy
- Packaging working
- Versioning strategy defined
- Release checklist created

title: Implement structured logging framework
description: Build structured logging with JSON output: log levels (debug, info, warn, error), context fields (user_id, provider, operation), correlation IDs for request tracing. Configure log rotation and retention.

title: Create health check and diagnostics endpoints
description: Build health check: verify database connection, check provider API reachability, validate token validity, measure sync lag. Create diagnostics command: show config, list accounts, check storage usage.

title: Design metrics and monitoring dashboards
description: Instrument key metrics: sync duration, API latency (Gmail/Outlook), error rates by provider, storage size growth, rule execution count. Export to Prometheus/StatsD. Create Grafana dashboard templates.

title: Build release packaging and versioning
description: Create release pipeline: version tagging, changelog generation, artifact building (binaries for macOS/Linux/Windows), checksum verification. Support semantic versioning with migration guides.

title: Implement automated update mechanism
description: Build in-app update checker: query GitHub releases API, compare versions, download and verify updates, prompt user with changelog. Support auto-update opt-in and manual update workflow.

title: Create operational runbooks
description: Document common operational scenarios: account re-authorization, sync troubleshooting, database corruption recovery, provider API changes. Create incident response playbook for support team.

title: Build telemetry and crash reporting
description: Implement opt-in crash reporting with stack traces, system info, anonymized usage stats. Use Sentry or similar. Respect user privacy: no email content in telemetry, clear opt-out mechanism.

title: E2: Canonical Mail Model + Provider Abstraction
description: Define normalized entities across Gmail/Outlook/Fastmail/IMAP: Message, Thread, Label/Folder, Rule, Alias, Attachment, Identity. Create provider capability matrix.
acceptance_criteria:
- Canonical models defined with fields + identifiers
- Provider mapping documented
- Capability matrix created
- Data transformation rules specified

title: Define Message canonical schema
description: Design Message schema with fields: id, threadId, from, to, cc, bcc, subject, bodyText, bodyHtml, attachments[], receivedAt, labels[], folderId, provider-specific metadata. Include Gmail msgId mapping and Outlook Graph message mapping.

title: Define Thread canonical schema
description: Design Thread schema with id, subject, messageIds[], participants[], lastMessageAt, messageCount, labels[]. Map Gmail thread semantics vs Outlook conversation ID.

title: Define Label/Folder abstraction
description: Design label/folder model supporting Gmail multi-label and Outlook single-folder semantics. Define canonical Label schema with id, name, color, type (system/user), provider mappings.

title: Create provider capability matrix
description: Document capability matrix for Gmail, Outlook, IMAP, Fastmail. Features: multi-label, delta sync, search operators, send with template, attachment inline. Mark PRIMARY vs SECONDARY features.

title: Define Attachment canonical schema
description: Design Attachment schema with id, filename, mimeType, size, inline flag, contentId. Include provider-specific storage strategies (Gmail attachmentId vs Outlook Graph download).

title: Document provider-specific quirks
description: Create quirks registry for Gmail (labels, historyId, RFC822 format) and Outlook (folders, deltaLink, MIME differences, tenant restrictions). Include mapping rules for edge cases.

title: E3: Connectors Framework (Connector SDK)
description: Standard interface for provider connectors. Includes connector interface, auth interface, delta/sync interface, local dev harness, and contract test skeleton.
acceptance_criteria:
- Connector interface defined
- Auth interface specified
- Delta/sync interface designed
- Local dev harness implemented
- Contract test framework ready

title: Design Connector interface/contract
description: Define TypeScript/Python Connector interface with methods: authenticate(), search(), fetchThread(), getLabels(), applyLabel(), moveToFolder(), sendMessage(), syncDelta(). Include capability flags and error handling contract.

title: Implement connector registry and loading
description: Build connector registry that dynamically loads providers (Gmail, Outlook, IMAP, Fastmail). Support plugin-style architecture with capability discovery and version checking.

title: Define error handling and retry strategy
description: Design error taxonomy (auth, rate-limit, network, provider-specific). Implement exponential backoff with jitter for Gmail API rate limits (250 quota/user/sec) and Outlook throttling.

title: Create connector configuration schema
description: Define YAML/JSON config schema for connector settings: provider type, credentials path, rate limits, retry policy, feature flags (delta-sync, multi-label, etc).

title: Implement pagination abstraction
description: Build unified pagination interface handling Gmail nextPageToken, Outlook @odata.nextLink, IMAP UID ranges, Fastmail JMAP position. Support page size configuration per provider.

title: Build connector test harness
description: Create test framework with mock providers for unit tests, integration test suite with real Gmail/Outlook test accounts, and contract verification tests for all connector methods.

title: E4: Provider Connectors (Gmail + Outlook PRIMARY)
description: Implement connectors for Gmail (PRIMARY), Outlook (PRIMARY), IMAP fallback (SECONDARY), and Fastmail (OPTIONAL). Gmail + Outlook are V1 must-haves with full feature support. Each supports search, fetch thread, labels/folders, apply/move, send with capability flags.
acceptance_criteria:
- All 4 connectors implemented
- Each supports required operations
- Capability flags documented
- Integration tests passing

title: E4.1: Fastmail (JMAP) Connector
description: OPTIONAL/SECONDARY: Implement Fastmail connector using JMAP protocol. Full JMAP support but lower priority than Gmail/Outlook in V1.
acceptance_criteria:
- JMAP client implemented
- Auth flow working
- All required operations supported
- Tests passing

title: Implement JMAP client for Fastmail
description: Build JMAP client using JMAP Core spec. Implement methods: Email/query, Email/get, Email/set, Mailbox/get. Use Fastmail's JMAP endpoint (https://api.fastmail.com/jmap/).

title: Build JMAP search query translator
description: Translate canonical queries to JMAP Email/query format. Support operators: from, to, subject, hasAttachment, inMailbox, before/after dates. Leverage JMAP's powerful query language.

title: Implement Fastmail mailbox management
description: Build mailbox operations via Mailbox/get, Mailbox/set. Map mailboxes to canonical labels. Support role-based mailboxes (inbox, sent, trash). Handle nested mailbox hierarchies.

title: Create JMAP state change tracking
description: Implement JMAP state tracking using Email/changes method. Track 'state' token, fetch changed emails efficiently. Handle state expiry and fallback to full resync. Test against Fastmail test account.

title: E4.2: Gmail Connector
description: PRIMARY V1 CONNECTOR: Implement Gmail connector using Gmail API. Full support for search, fetch, labels, threading, move, send operations. Uses Gmail History API for delta sync.
acceptance_criteria:
- Gmail API client implemented
- OAuth flow working
- All required operations supported
- Tests passing

title: Implement Gmail API client wrapper
description: Build Gmail API client using official library. Implement methods: users.messages.list, users.threads.get, users.labels.list, users.messages.modify. Handle quotas (250 req/user/sec) and batch operations.

title: Build Gmail search query translator
description: Translate canonical search queries to Gmail's query format. Support operators: from, to, subject, has:attachment, label, newer_than. Map advanced operators to Gmail syntax.

title: Implement Gmail label management
description: Build label operations: create, update, delete labels. Handle system labels (INBOX, SENT, TRASH) vs user labels. Support label color setting. Implement label hierarchy (nested labels).

title: Build Gmail send with threading
description: Implement message send via Gmail API with proper threading (References, In-Reply-To headers). Support attachments upload, HTML/plaintext body. Handle send errors (quota, invalid recipient).

title: Create Gmail History API integration tests
description: Build integration tests against real Gmail test account: test delta sync, label operations, search, send. Verify historyId tracking, handle history expiry (7 days), test full resync fallback.

title: E4.3: Outlook (Graph) Connector
description: PRIMARY V1 CONNECTOR: Implement Outlook connector using Microsoft Graph API. Full support for search, fetch, folders (map to labels), conversations, move, send operations. Uses Graph delta query for sync.
acceptance_criteria:
- Graph API client implemented
- OAuth flow working
- All required operations supported
- Tests passing

title: Implement Microsoft Graph client wrapper
description: Build Graph API client using @microsoft/microsoft-graph-client. Implement endpoints: /messages, /mailFolders, /messages/send. Handle throttling (429 responses) and retry-after headers.

title: Build Outlook folder to label mapper
description: Map Outlook single-folder model to canonical multi-label abstraction. Track message folder location, simulate labels with custom properties. Handle well-known folders (Inbox, SentItems, DeletedItems).

title: Implement Outlook search with
description: Build search using Graph  and  parameters. Translate canonical queries to OData syntax. Support operators: from, receivedDateTime, hasAttachments, subject contains. Handle search limitations.

title: Build Outlook send via Graph sendMail
description: Implement message send using /sendMail endpoint. Support reply/forward with conversationId threading. Handle attachments (<4MB inline, >4MB upload session). Test with personal and organizational accounts.

title: Create Outlook delta query integration tests
description: Build tests for /delta endpoint: verify deltaLink tracking, test message changes (add/update/delete), handle deltaLink expiry, test folder move operations. Use real Outlook test account.

title: E4.4: IMAP/SMTP Fallback Connector
description: SECONDARY/FALLBACK: Implement generic IMAP/SMTP connector for providers without modern APIs. Basic operations with capability limitations. Lower priority than Gmail/Outlook.
acceptance_criteria:
- IMAP/SMTP client implemented
- Basic auth working
- Core operations supported
- Capability flags documented
- Tests passing

title: Implement IMAP client with IDLE support
description: Build IMAP client supporting IDLE for push notifications. Implement commands: SELECT, SEARCH, FETCH, STORE, APPEND. Handle connection keepalive and reconnect logic.

title: Build IMAP folder to label mapper
description: Map IMAP folders to canonical labels. Support hierarchical folders with delimiter detection. Handle special-use folders (\Sent, \Trash, \Drafts). Simulate multi-label with message copies (expensive).

title: Implement SMTP send integration
description: Build SMTP client for sending messages. Support authentication (PLAIN, LOGIN, CRAM-MD5), TLS encryption, proper MIME multipart encoding. Store sent messages in Sent folder via IMAP APPEND.

title: Create IMAP sync strategy (UID-based)
description: Implement UID-based sync: track UIDVALIDITY and UIDNEXT, detect new messages, handle UID reuse. No delta sync (full folder scans). Optimize with SEARCH to fetch only new UIDs.

title: E4.0: OAuth/Auth Flows for Gmail + Outlook (Shared)
description: Shared authentication infrastructure for primary V1 providers (Gmail + Outlook). Implements OAuth 2.0 local-first flows (device or local callback), encrypted token storage, and token refresh logic.
acceptance_criteria:
- Gmail OAuth local-first flow supported (device or local callback)
- Microsoft identity OAuth local-first flow supported
- Token storage spec (encrypted-at-rest locally) defined
- Token refresh logic implemented
- Consent screens tested for both providers

title: Design OAuth token storage schema
description: Define encrypted token storage format for Gmail + Outlook tokens. Specify encryption method, key derivation, and OS keychain integration.

title: Implement Gmail OAuth device flow
description: Implement OAuth 2.0 device flow for Gmail with local browser callback fallback. Handle consent screen and scope approval.

title: Implement Outlook OAuth device flow
description: Implement Microsoft identity OAuth 2.0 device flow for Outlook. Handle tenant consent and delegated permissions.

title: Implement token refresh logic
description: Automatic token refresh before expiry for both Gmail + Outlook. Handle refresh token rotation and errors.

title: E5: Sync + Index Layer (State + Deltas)
description: Make search + automation fast and consistent. Implement delta sync strategy per provider, storage schema, and reconciliation with idempotency.
acceptance_criteria:
- Delta sync strategy per provider
- Storage schema defined (sqlite/libsql or firestore)
- Choice justified in ADR
- Reconciliation strategy implemented
- Idempotency keys working

title: Design SQLite schema for local mail storage
description: Create SQLite schema with tables: messages, threads, labels, attachments, sync_state. Include FTS5 full-text search on subject+body. Design indexes for common queries (by thread, by label, by date).

title: Implement Gmail delta sync with History API
description: Build delta sync using Gmail History API with historyId tracking. Handle history types: messageAdded, messageDeleted, labelAdded, labelRemoved. Implement incremental sync with state persistence.

title: Implement Outlook delta sync with Graph deltaLink
description: Build delta sync using Microsoft Graph /delta endpoint with deltaLink/deltaToken. Handle @odata.deltaLink for changes. Map Outlook folder changes to label abstraction.

title: Build FTS5 full-text search layer
description: Implement SQLite FTS5 virtual table for subject+body search. Support advanced queries: phrase search, AND/OR/NOT operators, date ranges. Optimize for <100ms query times on 100K+ messages.

title: Design sync orchestration and conflict resolution
description: Build sync orchestrator handling initial sync, incremental sync, conflict resolution (local vs remote changes). Implement last-write-wins strategy with provider as source of truth.

title: Implement attachment caching strategy
description: Design LRU cache for attachments with configurable size limits. Lazy-load attachments on demand. Support Gmail attachmentId fetch and Outlook Graph  download.

title: Create sync monitoring and metrics
description: Instrument sync with metrics: sync duration, messages synced, errors encountered, storage size. Log sync operations for debugging. Track historyId/deltaLink state.

title: E6: Rules-as-Code Engine (with Audit + Rollback)
description: Safer-than-filters automation with rules DSL, dry run, audit log, and rollback strategy.
acceptance_criteria:
- Rules DSL defined (YAML/JSON)
- Versioning strategy documented
- Dry run (plan) implemented
- Audit log for each action
- Rollback strategy for bulk actions

title: Design YAML rules DSL specification
description: Define YAML schema for rules: version, name, enabled, conditions (field, operator, value), actions (apply_label, move_folder, mark_read, forward, delete). Support AND/OR logic, regex matching.

title: Implement rules parser and validator
description: Build YAML parser with schema validation. Check rule syntax, operator validity, action compatibility. Provide helpful error messages for malformed rules.

title: Build rules execution engine
description: Implement rule evaluation engine: match messages against conditions, execute actions in order. Support batch processing for performance. Track rule execution stats (matches, actions applied).

title: Implement dry-run mode for rule testing
description: Build dry-run simulator: evaluate rules without applying changes. Generate preview report: 'Rule X would match 42 messages and apply label Y'. Support time-travel testing on historical data.

title: Create audit log for rule actions
description: Design audit log table: timestamp, rule_name, message_id, action_type, before_state, after_state, success flag. Implement immutable append-only log with retention policy.

title: Implement rollback mechanism
description: Build rollback using audit log: reverse actions (remove label, restore to folder, mark unread). Support selective rollback: by rule, by time range, by message. Verify provider state before rollback.

title: Design rule scheduling and triggers
description: Implement rule triggers: on-sync (new messages), on-schedule (cron), on-demand (manual). Support different execution modes: real-time, batched, manual-only.

title: E7: MCP Server Surface (Unified Tools)
description: One MCP server with stable tools regardless of backend provider. Implements 10+ core email operations with provider routing and capability reporting.
acceptance_criteria:
- Tool schema defined
- Error model + pagination standards
- 10+ tools implemented: search_messages, get_message, get_thread, apply_label, move_message, create_rule, run_rule_plan, send_message, list_identities, create_alias
- Provider routing working
- Capability reporting implemented

title: Design MCP tool contract for email operations
description: Define MCP tools: mail_search, mail_get_thread, mail_list_labels, mail_apply_label, mail_move, mail_send, mail_list_rules, mail_apply_rule. Specify parameters, return schemas, error codes for each tool.

title: Implement MCP server scaffold
description: Build MCP server using Claude Code MCP SDK. Register tools, handle requests, route to appropriate connectors/services. Implement health check and capability discovery.

title: Build tool routing to connectors
description: Implement request routing: MCP tool calls â†’ Connector SDK â†’ Provider (Gmail/Outlook/IMAP). Handle multi-account scenarios (select active account). Map MCP parameters to provider-specific API calls.

title: Implement MCP response formatting
description: Design MCP response format: success/error status, data payload (messages, threads, labels), pagination metadata, provider-specific hints. Ensure Claude Code can parse and display results.

title: Create MCP error handling and retries
description: Implement MCP-level error handling: catch connector errors, format as MCP error responses, include actionable guidance. Support retry logic for transient failures (rate limits, network errors).

title: Build MCP integration tests
description: Create integration test suite: simulate Claude Code MCP calls, verify tool responses, test error scenarios, validate pagination. Use real Gmail/Outlook test accounts for end-to-end verification.

title: E8: No-Claw Triage UI (Minimal, Opinionated)
description: UI optimized for triage + automation, not reading every email. Includes inbox queue, thread view, rule builder with dry-run, and action log viewer.
acceptance_criteria:
- Inbox queue view implemented
- Thread view working
- Rule builder with dry-run plan viewer
- Action log viewer (audit)
- Responsive design
- Keyboard shortcuts

title: Design minimal triage UI wireframes
description: Create wireframes for inbox view, thread view, rule builder, audit log viewer. Keep UI minimal and keyboard-driven. Support Gmail-style shortcuts (j/k navigation, x select, e archive).

title: Build inbox thread list view
description: Implement thread list: show subject, participants, snippet, labels, unread status. Support sorting (date, sender, subject), filtering (label, unread, starred). Virtualized scrolling for 100K+ threads.

title: Implement thread detail/conversation view
description: Build conversation view: show all messages in thread with collapse/expand, display HTML/plaintext body, render attachments. Support quick actions: reply, forward, archive, label.

title: Create visual rule builder
description: Build UI for rule creation: condition builder (field dropdown, operator, value input), action selector (apply label, move folder, etc). Live preview showing affected messages. Export to YAML.

title: Build audit log viewer
description: Create audit viewer: filter by rule, date range, action type. Show before/after state, success/failure. Support rollback action with confirmation dialog. Paginated table with search.

title: Implement keyboard shortcuts and accessibility
description: Define keyboard shortcuts: navigation (j/k, enter), actions (x select, e archive, l label, r reply). Ensure WCAG 2.1 AA compliance: screen reader support, keyboard navigation, focus indicators.

title: Create UI integration tests with Playwright
description: Build end-to-end UI tests: load inbox, open thread, apply label, create rule, rollback action. Use Playwright for cross-browser testing. Mock backend for fast CI execution.

title: E9: Auth + Security + Compliance Baseline
description: Token handling, scopes, encryption, audit posture. Includes secret storage, OAuth flows, RBAC boundaries, and threat model.
acceptance_criteria:
- Secret storage policy defined
- Token rotation guidance documented
- OAuth device/callback flow per provider
- RBAC boundaries implemented
- Threat model documented
- Mitigations implemented
- Compliance baseline defined

title: Design OAuth 2.0 flow for local-first apps
description: Design OAuth flow supporting device code flow (no browser) and local callback (http://localhost). Handle consent screens for Gmail (scope selection) and Outlook (tenant admin consent). Document redirect URI configuration.

title: Implement encrypted token storage
description: Build token storage using OS keychain (macOS Keychain, Windows Credential Manager, Linux Secret Service). Encrypt tokens at rest with AES-256. Store refresh tokens securely, access tokens in memory only.

title: Build OAuth scope management
description: Define minimum required scopes: Gmail (readonly, modify, send), Outlook (Mail.ReadWrite, Mail.Send). Implement scope verification on startup. Handle scope changes and re-authorization flows.

title: Create security audit checklist
description: Document security controls: token encryption, no plaintext credentials, HTTPS-only API calls, input validation, rate limiting. Create pre-release security audit checklist covering OWASP Top 10.

title: Implement token refresh and expiry handling
description: Build automatic token refresh using refresh tokens. Handle token expiry (Gmail 1hr, Outlook varies). Implement graceful degradation: prompt for re-auth if refresh fails. Log token lifecycle events.

title: Design multi-account security model
description: Support multiple Gmail/Outlook accounts with separate token stores. Implement account isolation: prevent cross-account data leakage. Design account switching UX with clear visual indication of active account.

title: Create compliance documentation (GDPR/SOC2)
description: Document data handling practices: what data is stored locally, retention policy, user data deletion. Create privacy policy and terms of service templates. Document GDPR compliance measures (right to deletion, data portability).
